fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Youth, Single market, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives:
- competitiveness, RDI (research, development and innovation) and management of change, with particular attention for the impact on the industry of digitalisation and of sector-specific policies such as REACH and those related to nanotechnology, 
- active involvement in shaping the new European Pillar of Social Rights, 
- occupational health and safety, 
- sustainable employment and career development in light of demographic change,  
- training and lifelong learning, including the identification of future skills needs and skills mismatches, 
- labour mobility and work force migration,  
- dissemination of the Framework Agreement on Competence Profiles at national and company level, 
- following up of and contributing to industrial, energy and climate policies, 
- implementing the committee's Roadmap 2015-2020.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: ECEG is an independent association dealing with social affairs and social dialogue on behalf of the EU chemical industry. We are a recognised social partner on the EU level. ECEG also works closely with BusinessEurope within the European Employers Network (EEN). http://www.eceg.org/who-we-are/

goals__remit: The European Chemical Employers Group (ECEG) is the Brussels-based social affairs organisation of the European chemical industry and a recognised social partner in the Sector Social Dialogue Committee. The main area of activities is representing employers' interests in the chemical, pharmaceuticals, rubber and plastics industries.
